title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://www.contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/.

title: CONTRIBUTING

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reprex.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look Travis AppVeyor build status making changes. README contain badges continuous integration services used package. recommend tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

title: Introduction to the rebird package
text: can install stable version CRAN development version Github load package R session
code: install.packages("rebird") install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ropensci/rebird") library("rebird")

title: Introduction to the rebird package
text: eBird API server requires users provide API key, linked eBird user account. can pass ‘key’ argument rebird functions, highly recommend storing environment variable called EBIRD_KEY .Renviron file. don’t key, can obtain one https://ebird.org/api/keygen. can keep .Renviron file global R home directory (R.home()), user’s home directory (Sys.getenv("HOME")), current working directory (getwd()). Remember .Renviron loaded start R, add API key file restart R session. See ?Startup information R’s startup files. Furthermore, functions now use species codes, rather scientific names, species-specific requests. ’ve made switch easy providing species_code function, converts scientific name species code: species_code function can called within rebird functions, species code can specified directly.
code: species_code('sula variegata') ## Peruvian Booby (Sula variegata): perboo1 ## [1] "perboo1"

what: R Client for the eBird Database of Bird Observations
title: R Client for the eBird Database of Bird Observations
text: rebird package interface eBird webservices. eBird real-time, online bird checklist program. information, visit website: https://ebird.org/home API eBird webservices can accessed : https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/664302/S1ENwy59?version=latest

title: R Client for the eBird Database of Bird Observations
text: can install stable version CRAN development version Github
code: install.packages("rebird") install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ropensci/rebird")

title: R Client for the eBird Database of Bird Observations
text: Load package: eBird API server requires users provide API key, linked eBird user account. can pass ‘key’ argument rebird functions, highly recommend storing environment variable called EBIRD_KEY .Renviron file. don’t key, can obtain one https://ebird.org/api/keygen. can keep .Renviron file global R home directory (R.home()), user’s home directory (Sys.getenv("HOME")), current working directory (getwd()). Remember .Renviron loaded start R, add API key file restart R session. See ?Startup information R’s startup files. Furthermore, functions now use species codes, rather scientific names, species-specific requests. ’ve made switch easy providing species_code function, converts scientific name species code: species_code function can called within rebird functions, species code can specified directly.
code: library("rebird") species_code('sula variegata') #> Peruvian Booby (Sula variegata): perboo1 #> [1] "perboo1"

title: R Client for the eBird Database of Bird Observations

title: R Client for the eBird Database of Bird Observations
text: package part richer suite called spocc - Species Occurrence Data, along several packages, provide access occurrence records multiple databases. recommend using spocc primary R interface rebird unless needs limited single source.

title: R Client for the eBird Database of Bird Observations
text: interested eBird data may also want consider auk, R package helps extracting processing whole eBird dataset. functions rebird faster mostly limited accessing recent (.e. within last 30 days) observations, although ebirdfreq() provide historical frequency observation data. contrast, auk gives access full set ~ 500 million eBird observations. ecological applications, users require auk; however, use cases, e.g. building tools birders, rebird provides quicker easier way access data. rebird auk part rOpenSci project.

title: Download historical frequencies of bird observations from eBird — ebirdfreq

title: Download historical frequencies of bird observations from eBird — ebirdfreq
text: loctype String location type. Either "states", "counties", "hotspots". loc String location identifier. querying states provinces, two letter country code followed two letter state code separated "-" (e.g. "US-NY"). querying counties, states/provinces, appending county identifier dash. counties US, county codes 3-digit number specific state (e.g. Bronx County: "US-NY-005"). counties Canada, county codes two-letter identifiers (e.g. Metro Vancouver: "CA-BC-GV"). querying hotspots unique identifier 6-digit number prepended "L" (e.g. "L196159"). codes can found looking URL respective location/hotspot webpage (accessible "Explore Data" tab). startyear Starting year query. Defaults 1900. endyear Ending year query. Defaults current year specified Sys.Date(). startmonth Starting month query integer (1-12). Defaults January. endmonth Ending month query integer (1-12). Defaults December. long Logical, output long format? Defaults TRUE. FALSE output wide format. ... Curl options passed GET

title: Download historical frequencies of bird observations from eBird — ebirdfreq
text: function currently returns error, also provides constructed url manually obtain data location dates requested browser. data frame containing collected information. long format: "monthQt": month week (eBird data divides month four weeks) "comName": species common name "frequency": proportion times species seen specified week "sampleSize" number complete eBird checklists submitted specified given week @return wide format, first column species list columns individual weeks (four month). First row contains number complete checklists week.

title: Download historical frequencies of bird observations from eBird — ebirdfreq
text: function rebird function use API formulated url-based query instead. Now need logged eBird download frequency data, authenticate R, function work. functionality likely added API future, keeping function meantime, throws informative error, provides constructed url obtain frequency data manually browser.

title: Sightings at location determined by latitude/longitude — ebirdgeo
text: species Species code species interest. Scientific names can specified wrapped around  species_code function. Defaults NULL, sightings species returned. Defaults longitude based IP. dist Distance defining radius interest given lat/lng kilometers (0 50, defaults 25). back Number days back look observations (1 30, defaults 14). max Maximum number result rows return request (1 10000, defaults ). locale Language/locale response (translations available). See https://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Locale.html (defaults en_US). provisional flagged records reviewed included? (defaults FALSE). hotspot results limited sightings birding hotspots? (defaults FALSE). sleep Time (seconds) function sends API call (defaults zero. Set higher number using function loop many API calls). key eBird API key. can obtain one https://ebird.org/api/keygen. strongly recommend storing .Renviron file  environment variable called EBIRD_KEY. ... Curl options passed GET

text: cat Species category. String character vector one : "domestic", "form", "hybrid", "intergrade", "issf", "slash", "species", "spuh".  specified, defaults . info meaning species categories, see  https://ebird.org/science/use-ebird-data/-ebird-taxonomy. locale Language/locale response (translations available). See https://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Locale.html  https://support.ebird.org/en/support/solutions/articles/48000804865-bird-names--ebird  (defaults en_US). species Character vector eBird taxonomy species code(s). Limits query results taxa. Default NULL, limit taxa. key eBird API key. can obtain one https://ebird.org/api/keygen. strongly recommend storing .Renviron file  environment variable called EBIRD_KEY avoid constantly  supply key, avoid accidentally sharing publicly. ... Curl options passed GET

title: eBird Taxonomy — ebirdtaxonomy
text: data.frame containing collected information: "sciName": Taxon's scientific name. "comName": Taxon's common name. "speciesCode": Unique species code. "category": Taxon's species category. "taxonOrder": Numeric value determining order taxonomic lists presented. "bandingCodes": Taxon's ABA banding code(s). "comNameCodes": Taxon's common name code(s). "sciNameCodes": Taxon's scientific name code(s). "order": Taxon's order. "familyComName": Family's common name. "familySciName": Family's scientific name. "reportAs": Species code report taxon . "extinct": Logical, whether taxon considered extinct. "extinctYear": Year taxon became extinct. Currently unavailable.

code: nearestobs(   speciesCode,   lat = NULL,   lng = NULL,   dist = NULL,   back = NULL,   max = NULL,   locale = NULL,   provisional = FALSE,   hotspot = FALSE,   sleep = 0,   key = NULL,   ... )

title: Recent nearby observations of a species — nearestobs
text: speciesCode (required) Species code species interest.  Scientific names can specified wrapped around  species_code function. Defaults NULL, sightings species returned. See eBird taxonomy information: https://ebird.org/science/use-ebird-data/-ebird-taxonomy. lat Decimal latitude. value -90.00 90.00, two decimal places precision. Defaults latitude based IP. lng Decimal longitude. value -180.00 180.00, two decimal places precision. Defaults longitude based IP. dist Distance defining radius interest given lat/lng kilometers (0 50, defaults 25) back Number days back look observations (1 30, defaults 14). max Maximum number result rows return request (1 10000, defaults ). locale Language/locale response (translations available). See https://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Locale.html (defaults en_US). provisional flagged records reviewed included? (defaults FALSE). hotspot results limited sightings birding hotspots? (defaults FALSE). sleep Time (seconds) function sends API call (defaults zero. Set higher number using function loop many API calls). key eBird API key. can obtain one https://ebird.org/api/keygen. strongly recommend storing .Renviron file  environment variable called EBIRD_KEY. ... Curl options passed GET

title: Recent nearby observations of a species — nearestobs
text: data.frame containing collected information: "speciesCode": species code "comName": species common name "sciName" species' scientific name "locId": unique identifier location "locName": location name "obsDt": observation date formatted according ISO 8601    (e.g. 'YYYY-MM-DD', 'YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm'). Hours minutes excluded    observer report observation time. "howMany": number individuals observed, NA presence noted "lat": latitude location. "lng": longitude location. "obsValid": TRUE observation deemed valid either    automatic filters regional viewer, FALSE otherwise "obsReviewed": TRUE observation reviewed, FALSE otherwise "locationPrivate": TRUE location birding hotspot "subId": submission ID

title: rebird 1.3.9005
text: Added ebirdchecklist(), lets view individual checklists (thanks @RichardLitt @Rafnuss, #108). Made ebirdregioncheck(), ebirdhotspot(), ebirdloc() defunct. API tests now use vcr, saves “cassettes” tests can played CI running tests CI, instead storing API key run tests remotely every PR (thanks @slager). Updated rebird’s internal taxonomy 2023 taxonomic update.

title: rebird 1.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-20 Updated rebird’s internal taxonomy 2021 taxonomic update. Fix tests.

title: rebird 1.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-01-27 Added ebirdsubregionlist() lists sub-regions within specified region (thanks @dbradnum, #90). Disabled ebirdfreq() (now throws informative error) frequency data request can’t done website anymore without logging first. request might added eBird API near future (#88). Added ebirdhotspotlist() provides list hotspots region nearby coordinates (#87). Added ebirdregionspecies() provides list species codes seen location (thanks @dbradnum, #86). Added ebirdchecklistfeed() provides list checklists submitted given date region hotspot (thanks @mfoos, #79).

title: rebird 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-10-24 Updated internal taxonomy reflect changes 2019 Taxonomy Update (#76). Updated ebirdregioninfo() also provide information hotspots (thanks @gbabineau, #72). Added ebirdhistorical() provides historic observations date region hotspot (thanks @gbabineau, #74). Fixed broken API links README (thanks @mfoos, #75).

title: rebird 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-09-27 version switches functions new eBird API, given one previously used rebird retired October 1st. , many functions rebird changed, previous versions package work correctly.

title: rebird 1.0.0
text: biggest change new API queries (exception ebirdtaxonomy()) require users provide API key, linked eBird user account. See README.md package vignette info set key. Alternatively, key can provided argument functions. new API requests, thus rebird functions, now use species codes rather scientific names species-specific requests.

title: rebird 1.0.0
text: New species_code() function converts scientific name species code can called within functions. New ebirdregioninfo() function provides detailed information given eBird region .

title: rebird 1.0.0
text: ebirdregion() now uses loc first argument instead region allows regions hotspots specified.

title: rebird 1.0.0
text: Given changes eBird API, functions ebirdloc(), ebirdhotspot(), ebirdregioncheck() deprecated removed future releases. functions still work updated API, might cease near future. ebirdregion() functionality first two functions, ebirdregioninfo() provides informative interface ebirdregioncheck().
